page.title: 03THE RIVER PINN, HARROW.
page.content: The{River Pinn}flows on both sides of George V Avenue. The River Pinn is quite shallow and it trickles along. The River Pinns's banks are overgrown with nettles and wild flowers. There are{Pink Campions, Dead Nettles, Wild {Roses}and{Elderberry.}Along the river, trees twist so they form bridges. The river is quite polluted from people throwing rubbish into it. On the left-hand side of George V Avenue, the river is very straight, but on the right-hand side it is very twisty. The river always flows to the south west from the direction of Hatch End where the source of the river is found. From the left-hand bank of the River Pinn, you can see the farmhouse of {Pinner Park Farm.}
